Cancellation Reason Other:
LRP’s partnership with Method spanned nearly seven years, reflecting both product alignment and growing business needs. While Method effectively addressed early pain points around data centralization and project management, challenges with reporting, email tracking, and Microsoft integrations became limiting factors over time. Their decision to migrate to NetSuite aligns with their shift toward a more holistic ERP model.

We’re grateful for the collaboration, feedback, and long-term partnership, and we wish LRP continued success in their next chapter.

Cancellation Reason Other:
We’ve decided not to proceed with Method, but instead migrate to MS Dynamics with a temporary integrator for a number of reasons. 

 

We intend to move away from QuickBooks accounting in about a year to cloud based accounting, so moving to Method will require yet another CRM migration at that time.  It’s really not worth doing that.  Secondly, the permissions Method offers won’t allow our workforce to be adequately isolated to just their function without paying for a full membership for view only.  Finally, the MS Dynamics platform is significantly cheaper than using Method and QuickBooks together while being fully integrated with our MS365 accounts and systems.  MS Dynamics will give us the integrated platform and analytics we need as a growing business.

 

We appreciate you taking the time to show us your platform but unfortunately Method isn’t going to work for us.
Reason_Clean:

It’s really not worth doing that. Cancellation Reason Other: Kenny (partner who helped with the account setup) has shared:I’m not exactly sure.  The account was customized 100% to their requirements.  They use a Callrail solution for inbound forms and phone leads and that integrates to Method through Zapier.  On Friday I called an issue to their attention when they said they weren’t receiving leads into Method. I researched and found that they had exceeded their monthly Zapier limit and that they were changing Callrail numbers too quickly and Callrail had a notice that some leads may not be tracked which could mean that they also weren’t sent into Zapier to Method.  In both cases it was the client’s responsibility to update their accounts appropriately. Their integration with Method was at 100%.  In fact, I went overboard to do video training walkthroughs and highly customized back end work to meet their needs.  However, in many cases throughout working with the client they missed scheduled meetings, needed multiple trainings on the same issues, did not communicate effectively with each other or with me, and had issues cleaning up their inventory effectively.  My understanding is that they also fired 3 key people during the ramp up. I’ve sent an email to them this morning to clarify why the decision was made to cancel the Method solution because it was working 100%. Regards,Kenny
Reason_Clean: Kenny (partner who helped with the account setup) has shared:I’m not exactly sure.  The account was customized 100% to their requirements.  They use a Callrail solution for inbound forms and phone leads and that integrates to Method through Zapier.  On Friday I called an issue to their attention when they said they weren’t receiving leads into Method. I researched and found that they had exceeded their monthly Zapier limit and that they were changing Callrail numbers too quickly and Callrail had a notice that some leads may not be tracked which could mean that they also weren’t sent into Zapier to Method.  In both cases it was the client’s responsibility to update their accounts appropriately. Their integration with Method was at 100%.  In fact, I went overboard to do video training walkthroughs and highly customized back end work to meet their needs.  However, in many cases throughout working with the client they missed scheduled meetings, needed multiple trainings on the same issues, did not communicate effectively with each other or with me, and had issues cleaning up their inventory effectively.  My understanding is that they also fired 3 key people during the ramp up. I’ve sent an email to them this morning to clarify why the decision was made to cancel the Method solution because it was working 100%. Regards,Kenny

Cancellation Reason Other:
The field mapping and transfer from ACT was not successful.  I believe Method tried to ‘understand’ the import based on already existing records in our QB program, which often do not match our CRM records, and this created a dysfunctional blend of inaccurate data in the Method fields.

In my mind, complete synchronicity between our CRM and accounting software would in theory be the way forward, but in practice I believe it entails hundreds of hours of clean-up work (and more costly field mapping for the data transfer) to successfully match and merge.  

Please note:  Harsh was an amazing Method representative, he answered all our questions and helped us better understand Method.  We now know we have much to clean up before linking QB and our CRM.
Reason_Clean:
The field mapping and transfer from ACT was not successful.  I believe Method tried to ‘understand’ the import based on already existing records in our QB program, which often do not match our CRM records, and this created a dysfunctional blend of inaccurate data in the Method fields.

In my mind, complete synchronicity between our CRM and accounting software would in theory be the way forward, but in practice I believe it entails hundreds of hours of clean-up work (and more costly field mapping for the data transfer) to successfully match and merge.  

Please note:  Harsh was an amazing Method representative, he answered all our questions and helped us better understand Method.  We now know we have much to clean up before linking QB and our CRM.

Cancellation Reason Other:
Internal Reason: Daily utilization among the Seatrade team consistently hit 90%+, with an average of 300+ events actioned per day in Q4 2024.   The team gave it their full shot, they honestly just could get over how difficult it was to use the platform for day to day use.

While customization could solve some workflows, Tim (Champion and Decision-Maker) wanted his team to adopt the core application before investing in the platform. 

In particular - 3 key areas broke down the relationship:
1.) Issues with Reference Numbers, duplicating, not generating, overriding one another. 

2.) Difficulties on reporting and how many clicks it took to report on the information they needed.

3.) What s app integration (where they do most of their communication) was the nail in the coffin.
Reason_Clean:

Cancellation Reason Other: Southhouston was having persistant issues with Tax being incorrectly applied or ommited (along with discounts and shipping fees) to various high level customers throughout the year. Multiple times we went through support cases, tickets, and customizations to try to mitigate these, but the issues still cropped up. There were about 5 different issues that were all related to data quality and user input, but they were unable to change their process and resulted and just working out of QuickBooks. For example - there was an issue where if you leave shipping address blank the Sync engine does not honour the tax status of the customer, and will charge tax no matter what. At the end of the day - they were used to using the QB ecosystem where their data quality didnt matter and they could override the tax, shipping, and discount rates on the fly without following the rules of the sync engine. As a result - they stopped using method for creating or managing sales transactions after trying multiple times to follow best practicies - too many orders slipped through.
Reason_Clean: Southhouston was having persistant issues with Tax being incorrectly applied or ommited (along with discounts and shipping fees) to various high level customers throughout the year. Cancellation Reason Other:
We are being acquired by another large company and have to adopt to their CRM system.

Also, your software is a good solution and covers the basics, however, my initial engagement with your consulting group did not make a good impression on me, since I was asking for fixes to the bugs in the system and a few additions to the software that should have been there to begin with, such as account owner field, etc. Every time I got engaged with consulting group, I was offered to pay for another consulting session. This makes your organization more like one that is looking to get additional revenue quickly without emphasis on customer service and relationship building. Some times it is a good thing to establish good faith and trust without charging your clients for basic things that should be offered at no charge. Especially, when the consultants are charging me for one hour, so they can engage in a conversation and explain why the feature is not working or not included. That is simply a poor business practice. Other than that, all is good.
Reason_Clean:
We are being acquired by another large company and have to adopt to their CRM system.

Also, your software is a good solution and covers the basics, however, my initial engagement with your consulting group did not make a good impression on me, since I was asking for fixes to the bugs in the system and a few additions to the software that should have been there to begin with, such as account owner field, etc. Every time I got engaged with consulting group, I was offered to pay for another consulting session. This makes your organization more like one that is looking to get additional revenue quickly without emphasis on customer service and relationship building. Some times it is a good thing to establish good faith and trust without charging your clients for basic things that should be offered at no charge. Especially, when the consultants are charging me for one hour, so they can engage in a conversation and explain why the feature is not working or not included. That is simply a poor business practice. Other than that, all is good.

Cancellation Reason Other:
Customer stated not working for us. 
The customer was not willing to purchase additional customization to support their workflows. There were two significant deal breakers:

1.) They work with a number of custom items and configurations, not all of these items should live in QuickBooks. In theory they wanted to be able to use Items as (Wait for Sync Approval on estimates) but then convert them to QuickBooks only when the sales was complete.

2.) They had issues with the refernumber not populating on save and did not want to have Method take over numbering.
Reason_Clean:
Customer stated not working for us. 
The customer was not willing to purchase additional customization to support their workflows. There were two significant deal breakers:

1.) They work with a number of custom items and configurations, not all of these items should live in QuickBooks. In theory they wanted to be able to use Items as (Wait for Sync Approval on estimates) but then convert them to QuickBooks only when the sales was complete.

2.) They had issues with the refernumber not populating on save and did not want to have Method take over numbering.

Cancellation Reason Other:
I spoke with the customer, and they have decided not to proceed with Method CRM due to the following reasons:

Currency Billing Concern: Their new business is based in the U.S., but they prefer to be billed in CAD. Due to the unfavorable conversion rate, the cost for 5 users in USD is not ideal for them.

Salesforce Customization Advantage: The customer has a Salesforce implementation expert on their team who is offering to handle all necessary customizations for free. With this, and considering the currency exchange, the total cost would be comparable to Method but with added internal support.

I highlighted the advantages of Method CRM, including our deep QuickBooks integration and customization flexibility, but the customer has decided not to move forward.
Reason_Clean:

Salesforce Customization Advantage: The customer has a Salesforce implementation expert on their team who is offering to handle all necessary customizations for free. With this, and considering the currency exchange, the total cost would be comparable to Method but with added internal support.

Cancellation Reason Other:
Customer had 4 sales reps inviting up to 9.
We lost this 100% on sync and sync conflicts - The out of the box system is exactly what they wanted. Something online, that connected with QuickBooks to enter transactions.
Incredibly heavy usage in the first 30 days - logging in daily across 3 users.
One user logging over 100 sessions in 30 days.
Customer was a self serve QBDT Customer. Did not want a demo, just wanted the software to work.
Has a hosted file (took time to setup) - Had 2 support issues which our team tried to resolved (Unit of Measure Conflicts).
At the end was frustrated with the Sync and the challenges around our sync engine.   Opted to just have all users operate out of QuickBooks Desktop.
Method couldnt be trusted to operate their business day to day with a broken sync engine.

Cancellation Reason Other:
We are a small manufacturing company that lost work orders when moving from QuickBooks Desktop Enterprise to QuickBooks Enterprise Online. There are a lot of us. Your system adds that function, but is also a production scheduling and probably all the way to MRP II (with complete inventory tracking.... ).

While these are great, and we will likely move to a complete ERP system in the future, we are simply looking to replace that functionality today.

Your system is more than we need - and the costs associated to achieve only what we need exceed the benefit today.

As this is a significantly sized market, and a feeder for future options, perhaps you would consider an option that provides seamless work order integration, with only a product masterfile, that syncs with QuickBooks for sales and billing, without production scheduling (an add-on), inventory management (an add-on), mrp, MRP, or MRPII....

We would pay to replace our CRM (currently FreshSales) with yours, and for integrated work orders, but it would need to be reasonably priced for this market.

Good luck and best!

Tom
Reason_Clean:
We are a small manufacturing company that lost work orders when moving from QuickBooks Desktop Enterprise to QuickBooks Enterprise Online. There are a lot of us. Your system adds that function, but is also a production scheduling and probably all the way to MRP II (with complete inventory tracking.... ).

While these are great, and we will likely move to a complete ERP system in the future, we are simply looking to replace that functionality today.

Your system is more than we need - and the costs associated to achieve only what we need exceed the benefit today.

As this is a significantly sized market, and a feeder for future options, perhaps you would consider an option that provides seamless work order integration, with only a product masterfile, that syncs with QuickBooks for sales and billing, without production scheduling (an add-on), inventory management (an add-on), mrp, MRP, or MRPII....

We would pay to replace our CRM (currently FreshSales) with yours, and for integrated work orders, but it would need to be reasonably priced for this market.

Cancellation Reason Other:
In every possible way.
We originally were happy with the free trial and then decided to purchase the year.
Upon activation, we noticed that Method was making changes in our system.  This caused accounts to become unbalanced and for us to have more work to do to repair relationships with customers who noticed changes to thier accounts that put their accounts out of balance.
We worked with Method for months to try to rectify the problems, or at least get an accounting of what changes were made by Method so that we could correct it.  We were only told that they didn't know the cause of the problem.  We continued to look for solutions and Method only agreed to help us if we could leave the sync enabled 24/7.  Since we knew that doing that would continue to harm our business, we tried really hard to work with Method for other solutions.  Eventually the Method support team threw up their hands and refused to take responsibility for any changes made to our accounts.  We sufficiently proved that it wasn't us doing this intentionally, by the way.  
We then requested a refund for the remainder of the unused year which was summarily denied.  We were told that since the causes of the problem were  unknown  and required more harm to our business to figure out the cause, that they would not consider a refund appeal either.
The main reason we picked Method over other CRMs was it's  seamless  integration with Quickbooks.  It more than failed to deliver on its promise, it actually made things worse.
Reason_Clean:

Cancellation Reason Other:
Thanks for one hour of free support. 

 

First, I only need one user to start, with a monthly subscription, to prove this will work for us.  We may or may not add users later.  I was told that the minimum subscription is three users.  From what I see online, your website does not state there is a minimum of 3 subscriptions required.  I did not like what seemed to be a sales tactic, and we do not want extra expense – especially while we determine if Method will work for us.  The 14 day trial was not long enough for the determination.

 

Second, I believe that a Packing List or Packing Slip is a simple requirement for many companies – and is a simple form.  I understand that some may want or need to pay for customization, but Quickbooks provides a simple option to print a packing list for every invoice.  It is easy, and it is not complicated to do – even if you just matched the Quickbooks form.  Paying Method approximately $150. per hour to generate a simple Packing List (which Quickbooks already provides), should not cost any extra.

 

Thank You,

 

Steve Jordal

Cancellation Reason Other:
1. They have QB hosted on a server and the method Sync engine as well. For the real-time sync, we have to have the QB open and connected to Method.
2. Their workflow is they have different users going to Single User mode frequently in QBs on their individual side (desktop). So, as we know when any user goes to Single User, other users have to log out.
3. This results in the user currently signed into QB on the server exiting forcefully and thus the sync engine is disconnected.
4. We asked them to install it on a dedicated system where one is working actively at all times and can use it as the Main sync engine. But the conflict is, going to Single User logs out every other user and eventually, it will disconnect sync at that moment.
Reason_Clean:
1. They have QB hosted on a server and the method Sync engine as well. For the real-time sync, we have to have the QB open and connected to Method.
2. Their workflow is they have different users going to Single User mode frequently in QBs on their individual side (desktop). So, as we know when any user goes to Single User, other users have to log out.
3. This results in the user currently signed into QB on the server exiting forcefully and thus the sync engine is disconnected.
4. We asked them to install it on a dedicated system where one is working actively at all times and can use it as the Main sync engine. But the conflict is, going to Single User logs out every other user and eventually, it will disconnect sync at that moment.

We need to have that ability so we were back to manually having to enter invoice and estimate numbers. All in all, my team demanded the simplicity of Jobber. Out of the box, Jobber meets almost all of our needs and Method would require too much customization to get there. Thank you.

Cancellation Reason Other:
The customer finds the Opportunities feature in Method CRM cumbersome and not user-friendly, especially since they lack an in-house sales team to delegate tasks. The repetitive workflow of creating opportunities, navigating to activities, manually entering conversation summaries, and setting follow-ups is seen as time-consuming and counterproductive, leading them to prefer managing their family business using an iPhone calendar.

While they acknowledged that the catalogs we were going to install could have added value, the primary reason for their cancellation is the burdensome process of managing conversations and follow-ups within the CRM.

Cancellation Reason Other:
Customer Feedback:customization times are too great with end results not being user friendly enough. Cost because to high with still too many glitches.

------

Internal Feedback:
Thinks the idea behind Method is great
Found the workflow and navigation throughout Method was a little choppy and not very smooth
They were hoping to achieve the following with customizations;
Create a quote > Convert to a Work Order > Convert in to an Invoice > Automatically create a sign off sheet that they send off to the customer.
They were hoping to do this without many clicks and as much automation as possible
Have a budget of about $2,500
During their Free Hour, they felt like their requests were addressed quickly
When they started their Pay Per Use, they realized that this was going to take a lot longer and more money than they hoped
They felt like there may have been a gap in experience between working with Thomas in their Free Hour and then with Zain in their Pay Per Use. They also said that Zain did a good job setting expectations and with his communication, just the overall investment to bring their requests to reality scared them off
I explained to Carl that we have a new consulting package that may be able to help them with their budget. I am going to send a follow up email speaking to PME vs PPU and see if they would be interested
Carl said to send this over and he will bring this to ownership to see if this is more aligned on what they are hoping for in regards to their budget. If so, they may reinstate their account and move forward with the work
Reason_Clean:
Customer Feedback:customization times are too great with end results not being user friendly enough. Cost because to high with still too many glitches.

------

Internal Feedback:
Thinks the idea behind Method is great
Found the workflow and navigation throughout Method was a little choppy and not very smooth
They were hoping to achieve the following with customizations;
Create a quote > Convert to a Work Order > Convert in to an Invoice > Automatically create a sign off sheet that they send off to the customer.
They were hoping to do this without many clicks and as much automation as possible
Have a budget of about $2,500
During their Free Hour, they felt like their requests were addressed quickly
When they started their Pay Per Use, they realized that this was going to take a lot longer and more money than they hoped
They felt like there may have been a gap in experience between working with Thomas in their Free Hour and then with Zain in their Pay Per Use. They also said that Zain did a good job setting expectations and with his communication, just the overall investment to bring their requests to reality scared them off
I explained to Carl that we have a new consulting package that may be able to help them with their budget. I am going to send a follow up email speaking to PME vs PPU and see if they would be interested
Carl said to send this over and he will bring this to ownership to see if this is more aligned on what they are hoping for in regards to their budget. If so, they may reinstate their account and move forward with the work

Cancellation Reason Other:
Forced into syncing QuickBooks while trying to get a demo. I was looking for a client, not my company, and just wanted a demo. 

After that, a ton of messages came in, urging me to sync my QuickBooks. These came even after I had reported that I wanted to make sure my account is shut down. 

Emails back and forth about how to cancel my account. The UX is terrible - looks great but the interaction design isn't thought out at all. The icing on the cake was when I found the actual Cancel button, in light gray, lower right on my screen, below the text about irrelevant things on the page. 

Well, I hope you use these observations to improve the product.
Reason_Clean:
Forced into syncing QuickBooks while trying to get a demo. I was looking for a client, not my company, and just wanted a demo. 

After that, a ton of messages came in, urging me to sync my QuickBooks. These came even after I had reported that I wanted to make sure my account is shut down. 

Emails back and forth about how to cancel my account. The UX is terrible - looks great but the interaction design isn't thought out at all. The icing on the cake was when I found the actual Cancel button, in light gray, lower right on my screen, below the text about irrelevant things on the page. 

Well, I hope you use these observations to improve the product.

Cancellation Reason Other:
Would not even allow me a 3 month credit for a longer than usual transition period from QB desktop to QBO, a move that would have cost your company virtually nothing; and instead dismissed a subscription customer and potentially tens of thousands of dollars in recurring revenue. 

With such a good team in place for customer service, it is a shame that your corporate financial decisionmakers, or whomever thought that was not a reasonable request, should be terminated. 

A no refund policy is one thing, throwing recurring revenue out the window is another. This was a horrible, time wasting, money wasting experience for everyone involved and I don't see how this company expects to succeed with a product that is not ready for prime time, and a c-suite that is tone deaf to it's customers actual requirements and expectations.

Cancellation Reason Other:
Arnab signed up in November 2024 and began a Dedicated Enhancement Plan in January 2025 with the goal of capturing customer sales data through a custom dashboard. Due to internal delays, work did not begin until late January. While progress was made over several months, the project moved slowly and key recommendations, such as adding more hours to accelerate work, were rejected.

By May, Arnab began testing the solution but grew frustrated with the pace and the limitations of the stock reporting UI, which he felt should not require paid customization. He temporarily canceled, reinstated after leadership discussions, and then raised concerns again in June about app tile issues and billing.

Despite progress shown in a June 5 meeting, Arnab remained unsatisfied with the reporting experience and ultimately chose to cancel his account permanently that evening.
Reason_Clean:
Arnab signed up in November 2024 and began a Dedicated Enhancement Plan in January 2025 with the goal of capturing customer sales data through a custom dashboard. Due to internal delays, work did not begin until late January. While progress was made over several months, the project moved slowly and key recommendations, such as adding more hours to accelerate work, were rejected.

By May, Arnab began testing the solution but grew frustrated with the pace and the limitations of the stock reporting UI, which he felt should not require paid customization. He temporarily canceled, reinstated after leadership discussions, and then raised concerns again in June about app tile issues and billing.

Despite progress shown in a June 5 meeting, Arnab remained unsatisfied with the reporting experience and ultimately chose to cancel his account permanently that evening.

Cancellation Reason Other:
On the good side for Method:
- LOVE that it is totally QB driven. It is clear who is and is not a customer.
- Really appreciate that it is a company with whom we had a human being as a contact. And one person. With a name. Who knew what the system did and did not do and was totally clear about it, did not fumfuh or BS.
 
On the negative side (things that are fixable):
- The interface was not totally clear to us as users. How do simply create a user-specific list of contacts, to-do’s, etc., was not clear to us.
 - The lack of a strong interface with Outlook. At least a bcc to Method would have made Method a possibility for us.
 
On the negative side (things that are beyond your control)
- Our users have used salesforce before so it was not “ugh, another new thing?!”
- Salesforce is a highly developed product so it has the outlook interface, the QB link, yada yada. I felt that we were moving to the industry standard, a more defensible decision to my team. (I view our team as my “board of directors” in this.”
 
I really wish you guys all the best and hope you keep building out a great system. It could easily be that we use it for another of our companies in the future.

I also use an over-arching group on every estimate, as I do not reprint the details of the estimate for the customer (my contracts are lump sum, they only see one number and no details of what goes into that number).  

Also, Method seems to be lacking for tracking project life cycle.

Stage 1: Purchase Order: generally where orders come in usually here is where we have to check that their pricing from the pourchase order is correct with our current pricing. Our pricing generally changes once a year and is based on volume. If we could have some sort of pricing rules built in to reflect that, that would be great.
 
Stage 2: Invoice: Usually if there is a price change we then send a final invoice to the customer for approval.

Stage 3: Payment: some of our customers require payment up front, others we bill after the product has shipped.

Stage 4: Custom Printing: some of our products have the option for custom printing. Generally, the process of this goes:

                Customer sends us their logo

                Logo created into a proof

                Send to customer for approval

               Having steps for each of these and even a way to send the proof where they can just click accept or reject with comments, would be great.

Stage 5: Fulfillment: this is where orders are filled in our warehouse

Stage 6: Shipping:  once the order is fulfilled, we are notified it is ready to ship where we then arrange for a truck to come pick it up or if smaller use standard mail to ship it out

Stage 7: Send Bill: if the customer does not require prepayment, we would send the invoice once the product has been shipped.

Discussion:

I explained to Mike that their request would need to be scoped out, and since they had already used their 1 Free Hour, they would need to sign up for the Pay-Per-Use (PPU) service. Unfortunately, they felt that our PPU was too expensive and were unwilling to proceed with it. I clarified our processes to ensure expectations were clear, but they were still dissatisfied with the costs involved in customizing their requirements in Method.
Reason_Clean:

Cancellation Reason Other:
While I found the QB integration was very well done with Method, a large amount of our customer interface is via email (using MS Outlook).  I did not find your Outlook integration as well designed as some other CRM solutions ... I am currently evaluating other CRM solutions (including "Prophet", which is very tightly integrated with Outlook, although it doesn't have the interface with QB) ... so, for me its a matter of trade-offs ... have a good CRM solution that integrates with how we communicate with customers, or a good CRM solution that integrates with our accounting software ... neither are optimal, but at this point I am looking at the "communications" aspect as being more important (with regards to a customer relationship management tool) than accounting.  I thank you for your assistance ... your product is good, but just wasn't the best fit for us.  
Regards,
Marc Summers

Cancellation Reason Other:
Ah, why am I cancelling...
Customer service was very helpful, and the people very nice. However, this is the most difficult and low-functioning CRM I've ever used. The UI is bland and hard to look at all day so I tried to use it as little as possible, which does NOT work for a CRM; there are non-sensical  pathways (far-from intuitive unless you're a developer) and the need for MANY clicks to get basic things done, if you can even find the right button. Data is difficult to manage and access, the customizations are expensive and inaccessible, reports are a joke. 
Not to mention how often we had web-lead errors, and down-time with Google gadget, etc.. 
We gave it a year, and I'm sorry we waited so long to cancel and move on. We spent so much money and time customizing to get the minimal function we did. We also lost dozens of leads to technical errors. Two weeks into a new CRM and everything is clicking, managers are happy, and CRM is fully functional. For example, I built a web-to-lead form and had it up on our website in 1 hour -  by myself!! It took weeks and hundreds of dollars to get so far with Method. 
I think your new version should have been worked on MUCH longer before you released it. It seems like we paid to have you guys finish working out the bugs in it. With the loss of leads and loss of time ($1000s in our time) trying to get this to work, I wish we had charged you instead of paying you.
Respectfully, Good luck, guys.
Reason_Clean:

Customer service was very helpful, and the people very nice. However, this is the most difficult and low-functioning CRM I've ever used. The UI is bland and hard to look at all day so I tried to use it as little as possible, which does NOT work for a CRM; there are non-sensical  pathways (far-from intuitive unless you're a developer) and the need for MANY clicks to get basic things done, if you can even find the right button. Data is difficult to manage and access, the customizations are expensive and inaccessible, reports are a joke. 
Not to mention how often we had web-lead errors, and down-time with Google gadget, etc.. 
We gave it a year, and I'm sorry we waited so long to cancel and move on. We spent so much money and time customizing to get the minimal function we did. We also lost dozens of leads to technical errors. Two weeks into a new CRM and everything is clicking, managers are happy, and CRM is fully functional. For example, I built a web-to-lead form and had it up on our website in 1 hour -  by myself!! It took weeks and hundreds of dollars to get so far with Method. 
I think your new version should have been worked on MUCH longer before you released it. It seems like we paid to have you guys finish working out the bugs in it. With the loss of leads and loss of time ($1000s in our time) trying to get this to work, I wish we had charged you instead of paying you.
Respectfully, Good luck, guys.

Cancellation Reason Other:
Thank you for following up. After careful consideration and multiple discussions with our team, we’ve determined that the most critical function for our CRM is integration with our existing Shopify account rather than QuickBooks. Since our current order flow runs from Shopify to Webgility to QuickBooks, a CRM that connects directly with Shopify is a better fit for our needs.

 

We’ve identified a solution that integrates seamlessly with Shopify without requiring any custom development or additional connectivity, and as a result, we’ve decided not to move forward with Method.

 

We truly appreciate your time and effort throughout this process.
Reason_Clean:

Cancellation Reason Other:
Being a small company we do not have the need for a robust tool like this. I would probably be the only one using it. Also, it's not expensive, but the cost is a consideration. I can use a different tool that is free to do the same kind of thing, with less automation, but entering new customers in Quickbooks is not a time-suck for me. 

Finally, the user interface was a little clunky and not easy to follow what I need to do next. I like visual management, so kanban boards and nice dashboards to sum up activities and opportunities. Also, I wish I could track existing customer reorders in the tool.
Reason_Clean:
Being a small company we do not have the need for a robust tool like this. I would probably be the only one using it. Also, it's not expensive, but the cost is a consideration. I can use a different tool that is free to do the same kind of thing, with less automation, but entering new customers in Quickbooks is not a time-suck for me. 

Finally, the user interface was a little clunky and not easy to follow what I need to do next. I like visual management, so kanban boards and nice dashboards to sum up activities and opportunities. Also, I wish I could track existing customer reorders in the tool.

She wanted a stand alone CRM which does not touch their QB at all and just in case if any lead gets converted to a customer, she can manually enter them in QB.

Cancellation Reason Other: Really liked the idea of syncing CRM with Quickbooks, Methods sync engine along with the ability to customize got us very excited. We are a small distribution company needing more than QB can deliver and have been on a hunt for two years to find an affordable option to replace QB. All of the EPR systems are just too expensive out of the gate.  Methods approach looked like a great option. But once we dove in to the trial we realize Method does not offer even the basic functions of a CRM out of the box, so here we go again with the never ending money pit of customization, just like all the other players in this space. When I discussed this with the sales agent all he could say was you have a free hour of customization.  I was very excited when I first found out about Method and sad it did not work out.
Reason_Clean: Really liked the idea of syncing CRM with Quickbooks, Methods sync engine along with the ability to customize got us very excited. Cancellation Reason Other: Price. We'd be willing to pay $25 a month for a 3-user license, but to pay $75 a month is really not a justifiable price, in our opinion, to pay for the minimal functionality we need, which boils down to tracking leads only. In QB we can track the customers with notes, to-do's, and everything. For our purposes, the only thing QB lacks is a way of tracking leads, and to pay a relatively high monthly fee just for that -- something we can do even on a spreadsheet at no cost -- the value is just not there.
Reason_Clean: Price. We'd be willing to pay $25 a month for a 3-user license, but to pay $75 a month is really not a justifiable price, in our opinion, to pay for the minimal functionality we need, which boils down to tracking leads only. In QB we can track the customers with notes, to-do's, and everything. For our purposes, the only thing QB lacks is a way of tracking leads, and to pay a relatively high monthly fee just for that -- something we can do even on a spreadsheet at no cost -- the value is just not there.

Cancellation Reason Other: Method does an excellent job of syncing with quickbooks but that is where its effectiveness really drops off. Your business plan to drive revenue by forcing businesses to purchase customization is not friendly or fun. The whole process is frustratingly broken and the CRM is not at all good out of the box compared to other CRM's in the market place at price points far below Method. Other CRM's provide world class support and customization for free as part of the service and the emphasis is on making my job easier not in frustrating me into purchasing customizations. Method is not user friendly, it is slow, and is over priced, and ultimately even though it has perhaps the best integration with quick-books overall its usefulness is far less than other CRM's. Bottom line Method is painful to use. I have enough pain in my day without purchasing it from you guys.For examples of superior CRM's Zoho - super friendly interface and features Vtiger another great CRM for an exceptional price. Ask those guys for anything and they fix it. bi weekly updates that actually include our requests. Biggest failure for Method is the approach.  Im looking for superior support and useability at an affordable price, not roadblocks and additional fees.  Good luck with your model and product.
Reason_Clean: Method does an excellent job of syncing with quickbooks but that is where its effectiveness really drops off. Your business plan to drive revenue by forcing businesses to purchase customization is not friendly or fun. The whole process is frustratingly broken and the CRM is not at all good out of the box compared to other CRM's in the market place at price points far below Method. Other CRM's provide world class support and customization for free as part of the service and the emphasis is on making my job easier not in frustrating me into purchasing customizations. Method is not user friendly, it is slow, and is over priced, and ultimately even though it has perhaps the best integration with quick-books overall its usefulness is far less than other CRM's. Bottom line Method is painful to use. I have enough pain in my day without purchasing it from you guys.For examples of superior CRM's Zoho - super friendly interface and features Vtiger another great CRM for an exceptional price. Ask those guys for anything and they fix it. bi weekly updates that actually include our requests. Biggest failure for Method is the approach.  Im looking for superior support and useability at an affordable price, not roadblocks and additional fees.  Good luck with your model and product.
